description: Set up a template to create new template versions automatically by tracking a linked repository. A linked repository is a repository that has been registered with Proton. For more information, see  CreateRepository. When a commit is pushed to your linked repository, Proton checks for changes to your repository template bundles. If it detects a template bundle change, a new major or minor version of its template is created, if the version doesn't already exist. For more information, see Template sync configurations in the Proton User Guide.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: The repository branch for your template.

parameters.name: repositoryProvider
parameters.description: The provider type for your repository.

parameters.name: templateName
parameters.description: The name of your registered template.

parameters.name: templateType
parameters.description: The type of the registered template.

nested_items.name: templateSyncConfig
nested_items.description: The template sync configuration detail data that's returned by Proton.

nested_items.name: subdirectory
nested_items.description: A subdirectory path to your template bundle version.
